column4: Sorry about the sad smiley, just need to change keymap :)
A quick question - I'm installing Ubuntu over my age old SUSE 10.0 - will it replace GRUB with a boot menu that recognizes the other OSes on my PC?
I dont understand that question.. xp cant read ext3 by default without ext2ifs
The installer will let you format partitions to whatever you want.. but you need to rephrase your question about what all you want to do.  brb
Current issue: Can only transfer files from Linux to XP, XP doesn't see it. Do I need to do something special in the Ubuntu installer for XP to see it?
You cannot make windows see ext3 without a driver in windows
YO mean a copy of your xorg.conf ?
When you say monitor config, which file are you refering to
So the file you want to edit and or copy is xorg.conf right
cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf ~/Desktop/Jacks-Notes/xorg.conf.$(date +%m-%d-%Y-%T)   will create copy on your desktop
I have told you a few different times.. you would need to do it in xorg
That indicates you have not set the v/h rates correctly for your monitor
No, the ones in Gnome are incorrect. My modelines were generated from a system tool called PowerStrip.
it looks for the cd, since the cd is still in your list.. go to synaptic - repos and de-select it
